column4: Absolutely poor service. They spoiled my New year eve completely. In this hotel they don’t care about clients. We booked King Grand Deluxe 2bedroom Suite Ocean View TWO BEDRM SUITE-OCEAN VIEW (120 m2) en BB, when we came to our room it turned out that we had just simple twin room for 4. I had to dispute with reception staff, which is extremely unfriendly! Room service doesn’t exist, in my opinion. I ordered 3 coca-cola 3 hours ago, I suppose that it’s better to go to the nearest shop to buy it! Never ever again I will stay here. Don’t be so silly to stay here!

Absolutely outstanding hotel perfectly located between Tangier and assails… Helpful, friendly staff who go above and beyond to make sure you have the best time… The front desk manager Nourdine’s welcome was very warm and professional, it was just getting busy when we wanted to check in, Nourdine came in, assisted us and made sure we were happy with the type of room and everything else. As a diamond member for the past 8 years I should be used to the extra attention and perks but this particular hotel and it’s wonderful staff really wowed us. All amenities were out of this world, the activities and facilities are for all ages. You really don’t need to leave the property as it has its own private beach, golf course, quads, pools, spa… you name it. ☺️ Also an excellent breakfast…

column3: Amazing beautiful place with so much to offer and great people to make your stay!
column4: Since the moment we arrived-we were well looked after! The hotel is just gorgeous, breakfast choices are superb, the apartment was huge with ocean views (you can never get tired of the view and the roar!) spa was a magical treat each day for me and is well set up. Kids club and activities are great too. My husband plays good golf and says that the course is in great condition, the design is very good too, much better solution to playing on costa del sole and paying a fortune. Pool was heated (so pleased! and we used it!) although out of season-we spend Christmas week here. The entertainment program was amazing-good music, beautiful food and kids party. The location and architecture is beautiful. I miss it all already. Most importantly-a big thank you to the people who looked…

Let me start by thanking your entire team at Hilton Resort Al Houara! I had an absolutely amazing stay on November 28 to Dec 1. I’ve long been a loyal Hilton brand portfolio customer and I’ve stayed at your hotels everywhere in the world, However, Al Houra in Tangier really stood among others and left me with quite an impression. I am really satisfied with the service, the cleanliness was immaculate, the food, facility, and just about everything I expected from Hilton but then your team surpassed a standard way above and beyond. It’s the little details and personal touches that really made me feel welcome and taken care of. I’m already planning my next stay, believe it or not. Please keep up the good work and extend my greetings to the rest of your team- Mohamed M’hamdi of…

Beautiful location staff was excellent. Felt like pricing was fair. You may pay little more for an airport transfer however so worth it no issues. Pool bar was excellent closed for winter. Breakfast buffet was outstanding as expected by Hilton. This location goes above any other properties of Hilton that I have stayed which makes for a great way to start a day. Great location for families must say pizza was really good only complaint is pizza should be on room service menu.

Lovely beachfront property. The rooms were comfortable, clean and the service was excellent. The spa/hamam was a nice touch for a western style hotel. A little far from town if you want to see Tangier, but taxis are quick. The pools were a bit cold in Oct, but that is not surprising.

column3: Very poor service (more specifically front desk service), staff and below 5-star average room set up.
column4: I have spent more than 450+ nights in 5 star Hilton hotels in the past 2 years. I've never seen such a bad front-desk service and staff/people quality (including in my stay across other hotel chain such as Mariott for similar Hilton standing) than in Hilton Tangier Al Houara Resort & Spa. Here is a list of elements that highlights the staff/people quality issues. I hope this will be picked up in the next staff stand up meeting as this location is very nice and the resourcing should match the quality of the resort infrastructure and expensive price: 1 element: Check-in at Front Desk with Mohamed H. : Front Desk staff member M.H. was not respectful at all and not welcoming. Staff member refused to find better room options or spend more time to discuss better room option while…

column3: The location is great the hotel is clean but the service is lousy …. Very rude young people at the front desk ..
column4: This hotel is well located and the rooms are very nice expect for the service. Staff are not well trained and unsure of the processes very unprofessional ,under-confident and straight out rude . The hotel is run by children and the service is slow . When i arrived at the room I had the welcome screen on the previous guest’s name and when I asked the front desk they just ignored my request !!!!! Very disappointing

I am very disapointed with how poor the Hotel management is!! They made an inacceptable mistake, they brought a crib adjusted on upper position for our 17 mo toddler, which is normally only fitting babies less than 6mo. We asked them to repair NON-STOP for 3h straight and they couldnt do! They advised us instead to put our baby sleeping between me and my husband which is very unsafe for him! Not only they ruined our mood and program but they took such things as the least concern which should be the priority of an international group! We dont play with safety and security of people, let alone todlers and babies where small acccidents can be fatale! They only made the effort when i went down to reception and complained! This is basic comfort and not acceptable mistake and service…

I couldn’t ask for more staying with my family in Hilton Tanger Al Houara Resort & Spa, the service was excellent from checking in to checking out, proper five star hotel, all my family did enjoy themselves, therefore I did book again this year to stay in the same hotel, because it was unforgettable stay for us and my family are very very very excited to have a nice and happy time in Hilton Al Houara. So see you soon lovely team.

column3: Not what you would expect from Hilton
column4: While the resort is beautiful the experience is not the standard you would expect from a Hilton Hotel. Staff are not well trained and unsure of the processes, very unprofessional and mix of over-friendly, under-confident, and straight-out rude. The hotel is overrun by children and the service is excruciatingly slow and inconsistent.

the resturant its just amazing.. best sunsets, great survice and incredible food! the guy thet surve me it was just wonderful.. he was so professional and in same time so frendly and funny.. love it.. hes name its Omar! difenetly gonna keep going there

column3: It is really a bad experience and I will not repeat it again
column4: The service was really bad, I asked many times to change my hair dryer which is broken , no respond. The evening service removed my soup without replacing a new one! No tooth brush glass is available in the bathroom. When I had my dinner in Olivier restaurant there was a cat wondering around my table and neighboring table! actually I visited many restaurants around the world but I haven't seen this except in street restaurants, but in 5 stars hotel it is really shocking.

It’s a pity that this wonderful property offers such a lousy service. Totally understaffed, nobody ever answers the phone! Waiters might take an hour yo take an order in the pool area, and for drinks & snacks to arrive an additional 40 minute wait is required. Drapes with holes, cero maintenance to rooms, poor cleaning. Really disappointed.

column3: Good hotel but service needs to be improved
column4: Nice buildings, nice lobby and pool. However, overall the service is not professional and slow. Rooms are not clean and the amenities they put in the bathroom are very limited. Kids club is small and designed for infants. Overall You get the feeling management are trying to cut cost. We stayed here when the hotel was newly opened and came back now. We did not see improvement in the service

column3: Wonderful Resort just outside of Tangier
column4: Great stay. The facility is very nice and in great condition. The service and the food were the stars of the show. Both were excellent. I can’t say enough about the team and how well they take care of the facility and the guests. It was a great experience. Remote location but plenty to do on property and the hotel team was very helpful in arranging transfers when needed.

We arrived at the hotel.. from the moment of drop off nobody took our bags or welcomed us. We then had to wait 70 minutes to check in with no apology. Check in was terribly disorganised and understaffed. Finally we got our rooms yet nobody was called to help us take our bags to the room I have stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels in the Middle East and North Africa. This was hands down the worst experience I ever had .. no communication, no apology, disorganised and chaotic. No information about the hotel was given… cold and impersonal

I may be generous with my 4 star review because the setting and food deserve a 5+ star review. We were shocked on how beautiful the grounds were. The pool area was stunning. The beach was incredible. The rooms were nice, however, we had no face cloths and had 2 bottles of body wash and no body cream. Our friends had no face cloths either. They also did not have a remote for the televisions and called twice and were told it was coming but never did. I forgot 2 items of clothes in the room and wanted them shipped to my next destination. When I called the first time, they asked me to call back. I did and no one knew of my first call. They took my number and never called back. We are travelling for 2 weeks with carryon luggage only. I needed those items.

If true paradise could be bestowed to us on earth then it would be Hilton Tangier. The service was second to none. The attention to detail of the staff members were second to none . The breakfast was to die for . Every member of staff from the Head of protocol to the F & B manager made our stay the most wonderful experience to date. The room service was astounding, the private beach was just divine.

Excellent service, lovely junior suite room well appointed with some lovely treats etc, buffet breakfast was very nice, pool area lovely , gardens very well maintained, staff were lovely highly recommend this hotel. Lovely views the restaurant l’Olivers the food was so so yummy and great attentive service

We had a great experience in this hotel! They received us with open arms! The food and service was excellent. We had a great service from khalid amaleri, who works with his heart! It was never to much what we asked, he always did it with a smile! Much appreciated! Then the food was so delicious! The pastry that was made by soulaymane benamar was great! This resort is excellent for people with or without children! We will come surely back! 😊

I couldn't have asked for better service. The staff were extremely attentive and welcoming. I wanted to eat at 8pm one night and the kitchen was closed for the moment but they talked to the chef and they made me dinner which was so kind! The pool, fitness center, and spa were all wonderful. Great place for a solo female traveller to get away from the busy city for the weekend.

column3: Thank you Oumaima and Mousad at the Olivier for a memorable experience.
column4: I had dinner at the Olivier restaurant and it was one of the best experiences i have had in a very long time. Beside that the food was excellent as it was couple nights ago, the service was exceptional. Oumaima who I think is the service manager and Mousad our waiter were exceptional. I dine out in the states 6-7 times a week and I would say this was one of the top experiences I ever had. We got there 10 min after they were closed and we were welcomed in anyways, they spent the hour or so that we were there just making sure we were comfortable and enjoying ourselves. By the time we got back to our room Oumaima made sure that our left over cheese plate and bottle of wine were nicely wrapped and on ice. All without even asking. I don’t usually wright reviews good or otherwise but…

It was great experience hotel was very very good huge with nice view very close to the sea a lot of Amenities and front desk was so kind and restaurant foods are delicious Chef’s and waiters are so kind with smiling face l remember one waiter names is (Sofiane) he was very kind and during your meal he s very attentive to if you need something else and restaurant manager was very friendly So during my stay l never had any issues l l left so happy thank you so much…

column3: Nice place to stay, full of flies! The hotel need professional marketing and communications and quality staff
column4: I had bad and good experience,... it was my wedding day i booked from booking.com i mentioned that was my special day in the website to make the room special.... but was no response... i arrived at night i find at the reception ALI who explained to me that i needed to call hilton directly and to pay a package 500dh arround 50€ For wedding to get this service... not to send a msg through booking... (he thought that i will beleive that was he was explaining) i dont know why they didn’t call me to explain that to me!!!! Guys it was my wedding day it was special for me!!!!!! I was very angry about that, but i kept my self cool... the funniest thing that he asked me to pay 350€ and 300dh because of the rate of euros is very down in hilton!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Are you Serious !!!!! So,…

column3: Thank you Khalid Amazeri for the good service at the Tocano Pool.
column4: The Hilton hotel is great overlooking the beautiful sea with good reception, good food and good service especially with Mr. Khalid Amazeri because he is nice, smiling and fast service and has a better future because he loves working good luck thanks

I was served at the pool by Khalid Amazeri, amazing service with a smile. he is running his legs from under his body to serve the clients in the best way. nice to see that a smile and good service can make a difference . he could be an example for other f&b staff

I recently stayed at this hotel for one night during a Moroccan road trip. Overall, there were definitely pros and cons throughout our stay. The positives: If you're looking for a relaxing and peaceful escape from the city, this resort checks that box. It's located about 25 minutes outside of the main city, on a secluded beach and nature preserve. They have free parking, and plenty of it, if you have a rental car. It's a sprawling resort, with multiple large pools, a beautiful lobby, and multiple areas to sit and watch the beach from a distance. As a Diamond member we were excited to be upgraded to a one bedroom apartment upon check-in and left a fruit basket and snacks in our room! We ate in one of the restaurants -- the food was very good and the ambience was peaceful. The…

column3: Beautiful location, but a bit of a dud
column4: The property is a bit rough around the edges despite having opened just before the pandemic. Guests still feel entitled to smoke inside the hotel in 2022, which does not line up with health and safety standards set by the brand. The property looks a bit shabby and dirty, and either needs to change the exterior color to better integrate with the environment, or invest in power washing. The food and service is excellent, and the location is wonderful. The place has prayer rooms, which was a nice surprise. The excursions on offer are grossly overpriced, as my "guide" spent 90% of the time on his phone and did not offer any personal insights or context to the place we traveled to, which was highly unprofessional. This is one of the nicer Hilton properties for families and…

My family and I have spent a lovely weekend there, rooms are beautifully appointed, lots of activities to do for kids and adults. Kudos to the staff members for their friendliness and attentiveness, we will return for sure!

Enjoyed the Spa, the Golf course, Pool, Beach and especially the horse riding. Went for an hour hack on beach and through forest on very well trained horses 🐎 with great energy and stamina. The gallops are unforgettable.

column3: The only place to stay in Tangier
column4: We went as a family to Hilton resort and had a fantastic time. The staff were super friendly and supportive of our family needs. Starting with housekeeping who went over and above to make us comfortable twice a day and reception staff who answered all queries we had. We appreciate Concierge’s Mouna and manager Jalil who helped us organise trips around Tangier and Blue city - definitely worth asking them about it. Ask about the daily free shuttle to town (10am). Also the restaurant staff topped it off with fabulous service and good food. Shout out to Btissam who took great care of us. You certainly get to try something you can’t pronounce ;) The facilities are also very nice with lovely endless ocean view, on the beach, a mini stable with the cutest pony, swings for kids and a…

Simply amazing! The views, the staff, the grounds, the service, the food, the location, absolutely family friendly so my 8 month old was very comfortable. They did nice things for my birthday too and welcomed us perfectly. We will definitely be coming back here for every celebration or just a family getaway. Special thanks to Mohammed (guest service) and the superb housekeeping girls Nawal and Siham. And the awesome ladies at breakfast in the photos

Very friendly staff, beautiful hotel. Recognition to Karima Boutjdir, lovely bar tender, smiley and very helpful. Very clean rooms, nice atmosphere. Will stay there again independently if for business or personal visit.

column3: All is smooth and good, recommended
column4: We had our first wedding anniversary and everything was cool and awesome. I also ordered a optional decoration in my room and it was very nice. Rooms are great, restaurant was also great. Just a tiny thing : for people who order semi-pension, you only get water, if you like to get a coke you need to pay extra. I think this shouldn’t be. It’s the same price anyways.

This hotel was a beautiful surprise. I had seen the photos and videos online, but I was still skeptical whether it could truly be a five-star experience. I can say with absolute confidence that it was. From the moment we were greeted by the friendly receptionist until the moment we left, we felt welcomed. The room (junior suite) was absolutely stunning. Beautifully designed, thoughtfully laid out. I wish we could have spent more time here than just one night, but I enjoyed every second of the visit. I normally shy away from large chain hotels, but this one felt bespoke, unique, individual. True luxury just minutes outside Tangier!

An extraordinary experience in quality and service, delivered by an amazing team that pays great attention to detail. From culinary delights, to hotel and conference services just super smooth and exceeding expectations. True Moroccan hospitality! We will be back!

column3:
Hotel reception scammers, unprofessional guest relations
2 hours check in and out
3 different bills
Do not go there!
column4: I have never seen a Hilton resort in my life with unprofessional management I have meet 3 different reception manager at this hotel in 2 hours of check in and they all blamed on eachother about my check in and my upgrade,Non of the managers wears name badge that’s why no one knows who is who. You can’t see Hilton standards in this resort All management and staff just focused on French speaking costumers or rich local customers All hotel staff are seeing you as a £€$ , if you don’t tip them every time they serve you .they wil stop serving u You need to check your bills at this hotel really cariful They are charging you extras and try to hide that wit sending you more then 3 different bills This Hilton hotel is a big scam Do not leave your debit or any card details in this…

Came to this hotel for one week, left this hotel with with a plan to surely come back again (Inchallah). This is my opportunity to say thank you for the service provided by all the staff within the hotel. Abdelhak at front desk thank you for your understanding and welcoming service you have provided us with. Another thanks to all the restaurant staff, your welcoming smiles were taken to heart. Another thank you to Noura and last but not least to Mohamed Rammel. Thank you all for the energy you put into this hotel, because of you guys we will be pleasure to coming back. Sept 2021 room 6110

First and foremost, 5 star hotel is well deserved. I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the staff within this hotel. My visit was very welcomed and I’m beyond honoured to have experienced a wonderful week at this hotel. My trip could not have been great without Mohamed Rammel who in fact was our house keeper. I would like to say thank you for making us feel home at the hotel and in our room. With the cleanliness and organisation on point. The fact that we leave for breakfast to come back to a clean and outstanding room, makes me want to come again. Your smile each morning gave joy to my family and we were always looking forward to cross paths in the hall way. You my dear deserve 10/10 due to your enthusiasm and positive spirit. This means a lot to me and my…

column3: A Beautiful Property In the Middle of Nowhere
column4: The hotel was absolutely beautiful with excellent service, especially at check in & concierge. There are a few things to consider: -The hotel is in between Tangier & Asilah, with nothing nearby. Taxis do not come to the property unless they are called, so factor this in when making a hotel decision if you don’t have a car. -Prices are very expensive for food & room service. -Our king suite had a stunning view of the ocean & property. It was unfortunate that the loud music from the pool area played until 10:00pm, especially when you consider that there were only 3 people near the area. Overall, I give the hotel a high rating because it was beautiful but the isolated location would discourage me from staying there again.

Very calm and clean , food was good staff very nice but the only thing no free soda of coffee or tea in the pool only in the room with the coffee machine but overall was a nice hotel to visite with pool and sea very near .

I have stayed with my family at Hilton Al Houara Tanger from 22.08.21 to 27.08.21, we had a great time from checking in to checking out, the staff were very friendly and helpful from the front office to the housekeeping and restaurant. The room was very clean, the swimming pool was outstanding, and because I liked this Hotel I had to make another booking for two more nights from 30.08.21 to 01.09.21, and because I liked it again I had to book one more night from 01.09.21 to 02.09.21. Over all I recommend Hilton Al Houara to all friends and family.

Best service! Very clean hotel! Wonderful breakfast and food in general ! I loved the people, everyone tried to make our stay as nice as possible! So special to hear staff memebers call your daughter by her name after just one day…

Very nice hotel , good location , top view and awesome breakfast . The staff was so friendly , want to mention the top service of the guest relation manager Ms Yasmine , she was so friendly , smiley and so helpful . Big thanks also to the all restaurant and the pool staff , they were so kind and helpful . To presume , we spent good holidays unforgettable , we will definitely come back Inshaalah.

Check in delayed taking too long to prepare my room give temporary room and give my room at 18.30. I booked a KING JUNIOR SUITE WITH OCEAN VIEW was given a 1 BED APARTMENT ROOM 6301which was on a cheaper rate. At check out spoke to the check out team and reservations manager who said he sets the price and half way through our discussion he walked away and never came back.

We had a room without warm water and the Guest Relation Manager Miss Yasmina A. has simply refused to make us change the room. In front of this behaviour unsuitable for a 5 stars Hotel employee, we insisted to have a new room and a commercial gesture. The Guest Relation Manager Miss Yasmina A. refused and threatened us to call security. After several hours in the reception, yelling and insisting to have a new room, an other manager accepted our request but we had to change 3 times a room an the last one didn’t have warm water neither. We were too tired to come back to the reception. I hope this Manager will be spotted by the hierarchy for her inability to answer to the basic requests coming from a client… Having warm water in a room and talking politely without arrogance.

column3: Flea in the suite and very bad service, DRAMA!
column4: Dear Dominique, I am staying in your hotel together with my child. I am just in chock right now as we found flies (flea) in our suite. It damaged my child’s head as well. I have pictures of it if you want to have a look. The first day we arrived while sleeping I found out the pillows are dirty and itchy! Apparently it was not only that but also flea! Not Mentioning the spas where I become sick last time I visited your hotel due to the very bad service and the fact they kept me without cloths 1 hours in the cold. The pool restaurant is that keeps us waiting 1 hours and 15 minutes waiting for the food and 20 minutes waiting for the bill. Yesterday I was receiving prestigious famous guests at my suite, and also my child needed to eat, I called the room service and explained…

column3: A lot of improvements for 5* star hotel
column4: Check in and check out long and bad process Dirty swimming pools some areas dangerous for child sharp Food very expensive ok but quality should match. Breakfast is bad for 5 star hotel (not diverse) …

column3: It’s ok but not resort wow experience
column4: In dining was terrible , some staff were not professional and had attitude , the pool needs cleaning. Too expensive for the service you get. Location had no shopping facilities and was bit far from everything else - I would recommend the hotel to have a shop for quick things.

The service is terrible. Have to follow up many times to get any service. The reception staff and restaurant staff don’t respect queue and time of order. The staff don’t have any training regarding Hilton membership. I have a Diamond membership and it was totally useless in this hotel. Probably the worst Hilton ever in service.

column3: Nice location but service is terrible
column4: - waited 2.5 hours for my room to be ready - waited 20mn over the phone to reach reception - waited 1.5 hours to be delivered food in room - the head of concierge Mr Talahoui is extremely rude and unhelpful

column3: Dont go - horrible service and high prices
column4: The hotel is new and on a. Nice site Nice rooms and access to the beach The service is terrible, the staff does not answer the phone, room service is terrible and prices are very high for the food Dont go its not worth it - unless you eat outside The dinner buffet is 35 eur for essentially pasta, rice and meat, no salads, no sea food, no fruits Honestly its a rip off and the hotel staff cannot manage the large number if people during this summer period Avoid this place

Check in was slow and very anarchic. We reserved a room with king size bed and we got small bed. Room was dirty with traces of previous visitors. Only one toilet paper in the bathroom. Beach access is not good and far from hotel. Food was extremely expensive (7$ for black coffee: 50 dirhams). I won’t go back again

Very nice hotel, we like it. All commodities available : pools, beautiful beach, sports, …, The location was very clean and spacious, confortable and calm. Delicious foods and beverages. You should try it.

column3: The only hotel I will recommend and use while in Tangier.
column4: The best service at all it’s amenities are unmatched, the food beverage are amazing, best room views and facilities. The only hotel I’ll recommend and stay at in Tangier. The check in was smooth, the pool was a paradise.

Hilton al haouara was amazing it was an amzing stay in there , we had our breakfast at Argan the stuff was good , and about the dinner we had it at olivier it was amazing with a wonderful view and a very special thanks to oumaima and mounia who were very friendly with us

Excellent Experience and Friendly Stuff, one of the best restaurants in town… the Servent Ali was so helpful and freindly… Bravo The food was so delicious and prices were affordable. We had Fish Assortment and it was fabulous

We would like to thank all the team of Hilton al Houara for our 2 weeks in Tangier. The stuff is very kind and professional. Thanks to REDOUANE in Argan restaurant for helping us during breakfast, IBRAHIM and other guys from lifeguard team, cleaning stuff, ALI from Olivier restaurant and nannys in kids club for playing with my children. Morocco is a beaitiful country, we have loved it! If you travel to Tangier, you have to stay in that hotel. It's far away from the town, but the beach is clean, large and beautiful.

I booked this hotel for a weekend of relaxation with friends and to use as a base to explore Chefchaouen. We were a group of 10 and thoroughly enjoyed our time here.I was warmly greeted by Besma at the Front Desk and checked in. She was very friendly and inviting, which was a welcome relief after a day of traveling. She was even kind enough to walk me to my suite. The service I received was top notch! While attempting to order room service there was a bit of an issue with the phone line. As a workaround, Omar came to my room and personally took the order, talk about going above and beyond! This was a very nice touch and I very tankful for this. I would also like to shoutout Mouna from the Concierge who very helpful with providing tips on things to do while in the area. The…

Staff was very friendly and helpful Room was perfect , the view is amazing, Breakfast was fine Although there were too many flies in our room , the hotel should think of treating them Also staurday night was very noisy , I understand that some people like to have fun in the week end but the volume was very high for the people who only want to chill in there room balcony

column3: Beautiful hotel but very Bad poor service
column4: Beautiful hotel but very Bad poor service. Sauna was cold they couldn’t solve the problem and left me in the cold for an hour , next day I became sick due to that. Room service was for 2 days not responding for 2 hours each evening, the reception could not help. Restaurant at the pool left you sitting for an hour nobody came to give you menu or ask 3 days in a row same behaviours, many people were complaining openly, kids club lady was away for 1,5 hour and left parents and childeren waiting in front of the door...etc etc

Really appreciated this trip. Awesome hotel, nice and welcoming people. The pools and the garden are amazing. The beach so close and calm, we enjoyed the sunsets over there. Our best stay in a Moroccan hotel! 👌🏼🤩

column3: Great hotel at a challenging time
column4: We chose this hotel because so many within Tangiers were closed because of the pandemic--what a great decision. The staff could not have done more to make us feel welcome, the food was fabulous and we were right on the beach with fun activities for the kids (horseback riding and quad driving). This ended up being the perfect end to our Morocco trip--the kids had fun while we toured Tangiers--our stay at the Hilton Tangier Al Hour Resort put everyone into a positive mood for facing the last few weeks of school after a long and difficult year. My son has specifically requested that we stay there again on our next trip to Morocco!

We had a great experience at the Hilton. The horse riding on to the beach was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. The view was absolutely breathtaking. We really enjoyed the ride thanks to the great staff.

We had a great stay in the hotel, great service. We had a mobility limited person with us and the porters specially Mehdi Benchekroun were extremely helpful. A great stay to do again. The rooms were clean and had a superb view to the sea.

Room 241 from 21 to 23 of March 3 days was so amazing and reception were very kind and professional and the room was clean and nice special thanks for Ali and Oussama ,Sara jamal F&B and hassania HSK And one Bell boy i forgot his name and am sure i will come back with my family again to hilton Houara and thank you for everything cz they made our stay very nice 👌

This property is located right on the beach, just a few minutes south from the TNG airport. The hotel is new, it's clean, and the design combines Moroccan charm with the restful and familiar sleek lines of Hilton hotels. The head of service, Jalil, was very attentive to our needs and checked in with us periodically. Loubna at the front desk was so kind to send us a treat to help celebrate a birthday. My wife and I travel extensively and have rarely had such good service. The only con, in our opinion: - the food was underwhelming, overall. The bread and pain au chocolat were good but restaurant entrees were all lacking. We were very pleased with our experience and we look forward to returning soon!

Hello I would like to dedicate this review to all the staff, and to all the members of your hotel to thank them for their wonderful job , especially the guy who named Omar and i wanna thank Majida also for her work . Although the "buffet" was a bit way below my expectations , but in generale the stay was great , due to the wonderful job that was done by Omar who was asking us everytime to check if we need something or to check if we are missing something , that made us feel like we are being well taking . Also Omar took care of the small details of the room , and as a men who went to hotels all over the world ( bahamas , albania , , nigeria ...) i never seen so much dedication as i have seen in the staff who took care of our room . A big hug to you guys , keep up the…

Everything was just excellent! From the Kids Club to the Spa. The hole staff was professional, helpful and friendly. Amazing and delicious food!! The 2 bedroom appartement with sea-view is very spacious and clean. Thank you for making our stay a memorable one!

Hotel was flawless especially the possibility to go horse riding with the beautiful sea view very friendly and professional staff in the name of Annas who controls the horses excellent Try the philly cheese steak sandwich as well

Amazing resort and staff. We love this place and have been here a couple of times. Truly 5 star from the interiors to the staff. Mr Jalil, the Food and Beverage supervisor and the whole team at breakfast are wonderful. Great place to come at anytime but especially during Covid as there’s plenty of space and the hotel have strict measures ensuring you feel safe.

We checked in for 3 nights this week and this wasn’t our first time in Hilton Houara, we did stay there for one night in August and it was full so we didn’t really enjoy it and we decided it to give it a second chance this time. I will start by all the positive things: really nice hotel, an awesome view and placement we got a room with an ocean view it was really nice, room clean and spacious The staff is really nice and friendly The pool is big and nice Food was good.. Dinner at L’olivier was delicious and on point Breakfast buffet was good and the supervisor was really nice and making sure everyone is getting the best service. So now the down side it was more maintenance issues: like fridge didn’t work properly in our room we had to drink warm water during entire stay …

The hotel is great in terms of cleanliness and decor. The pools and private beach alone are enough reasons to visit this place. The massages in their spa are sublime. What I liked most about the place is the great care taken by the staff, the hospitality and responsiveness especially from Achraf and Anouar. The only bad thing is that the food is average at best with extremely high prices. The pricing of the beverages is borderline lunacy. All in all, it's worth a visit.

Incredible staff, great room and a beautiful property. This place was kind of dead because it was their winter tike but it was still amazing and a great place to relax and enjoy the sights and sounds of this part od the world.

column3: A heavenly experience! Will go there again!
column4: This property is about 30 minutes from city of Tangier. This facility is an oasis and I can just visit Morocco to spend time at this resort and not do anything. Pristine, clean and beautiful resort! Highly recommended.

column3: Newish resort with teething issues to be addressed
column4: My wife and I stayed here for one night at the beginning of our Moroccan honeymoon road trip and had mixed feelings. We drove up from Casablanca on a Sunday afternoon and redeemed a Hilton Honors free weekend night certificate for the overnight stay. Check-in was slow, but pleasant as we were offered a seat while the hotel processed the paperwork. Prior to our arrival, I had advised the hotel of our honeymoon and upon checking-in, was pulled aside discreetly by Sarah to set a time for the room to be set up with a lovely towel+ petal arrangements, which my wife was very surprised by - thanks Sarah and team! We walked around the property to familiarise ourselves with the facilities, including the private beach and swimming pools and then had a yarn to the attendee serving mint tea…

We stayed here twice over Christmas 2019 and I have mixed feelings about our experience. The room was beautiful, it was a King suite with a fantastic view of the ocean and we loved listening to the waves at night time. The decor in the hotel itself is beautiful but some of the rooms are FAR away from the main reception area - almost 1/4 mile in some instances. We tried all the restaurants and the food was good. The spa is really great too.....the Moroccan hammam, ahhhhh! Fab. Having said all this I have to agree with the other recent poster. The customer service is really not good. Individually all the staff are very friendly and professional but they don't seem to talk to each other! If you raise an issue with one, you do get handed off to the next staff member and are…

We decided to stay at this Hilton as the hotel is relatively new, and we would like to do something special on New Year’s eve. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and we thought it would be a great family option. We were wrong. Service The service level at the front desk was absolutely appalling. At check in we were asked to sit on an uncomfortable bench opposite the reception (which was relatively small) and waited for the next available agent. No one paid us any attention for 15 minutes – so I marched up to the front desk and asked what was going on (considering we were driven there from Fes so we had a long day). Finally the Front desk supervisor checked us in (but was consistently speaking to various colleagues of hers so she was distracted), and that took another 10 minutes…

Together with friends we spend their couple of days including New Years eve the experience is 10 out of 10, service is very good, the hotel is beautiful clean and all the staff from the receptionists, bartenders, housekeeping, hosts, every and each one of them are friendly and helpful. Food at the Olivier restaurant is mouth watering well presented and excellent taste As well the food at Argan restaurant is delicious. The only thing it should be improved in both restaurants is the quickness, sometimes you have to wait a bit long before you get something on your table. But apart of that there’s nothing to complain. The experience at the spa was excellent. Well recommend hotel pool area is beautiful and 3 minutes walking to the beach. To all the staff thank you for…

with my husband, we welcomed the new year at the Hilton Tangier Al Houara Resort & Spa. it was a very nice stay. we wil definitly return there! the staff is very nice , smiling and professionnal. the restaurant experience was very nice. Bravo to the chef!

Honestly I was surprised to see this level of service and responsiveness in a nearby resort. Kids club amazingly good !!! The views and the resort theme is to die for too . Would def recommande and come back soon .

column3: A little piece of heaven in Tangiers
column4: Stayed at this property for 4 days , what an amazing property.We came as visitors and left as family. This five star property is a hidden gem ,amazing rooms,lovely pools ,with five star dining options. Staff at the hotel were friendly who went out of there way to make our stay comfortable. A warm welcome was given by Loobna who facilitated our special requests a thumbs up for er excellent service . The ladies and gentlemen at the spa a big thank you ,Nouhaila ,Ihsaan,Maryam and Walid. Thank you to Amine Chakib ,for your excellent people skills and excellent service at l Olivier. To your staff Soukaina , Abounakhla , Meryam , Lubna, Siham ,Jalaal and Sameer. Sometimes a short say develops memories for life. This one did. Would definitely be back in the summer to…

I recomend this hôtel...great service..Great Manager...breakfast top...near the beach and golf course. Outside of the City i spend a week-end with my Wife...it was great. We went to Tanger center, it took us 20mn to get there...great City.. Badraddine

The staff is very professional, welcoming and nice. The amenities are amazing and the hotel location perfect. I spent a great weekend there. The breakfast was a highlight of my stay. Would definitely come. Back.

Clean rooms, courteous staff, good food and drinks. Couldn't have expected more and wished I had stayed longer. Best part is the hospitality and the kindness of the staff all around the hotel, from the start to finish: Jalil, Rania, Janita, Fmei, the head chef and also the restaurant manager. All were amazing. Our special thanks to Jalil for going above and beyond to wow us and make our stay more memorable. My husband missed his flight and had to join me the next night. He arranged the taxi to pick me up from thw hotel to surprise my husband at the airport with some beautiful flowers. The luggage was with my husband, so I had nothing warm to wear. He gave his own jacket to me to wear and he went home without a jacket. Although that not was extremely cold. I have never seen…

Dream experience! Spent four wonderful days at the magnificent hotel and spa for my birthday. The staff was phenomenal, hotel room spacious and clean with picturesque views. The breakfast was awesome dinners were top notch and spa just relaxing. A must stay.

I am very happy with topservice of Chafika Limane this women make my room very beutiful she is very Nice and good person i Will come back to Hilton every time InshaAllah and warda help me also very good she is good chef i thank Chafika limane and warda for good time in Tangier hilton

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in October and we’ve had a wonderful stay. The hotel is stunning and the rooms are very clean and spacious. The pool area is really nice. The breakfast is really good and there are plenty of options from the buffet. We had dined in all of the restaurants and the food was very tasty, however, our favourite was the L’Olivier restaurant. The staff at this hotel are great. Everyone we’ve met from reception, housekeeping, restaurants and bars were all very friendly and helpful. It was my boyfriend’s birthday while we were staying and the staff have went out their way to decorate the room. It looked beautiful with rose petals everywhere and they even left a cake in the room. It was such a lovely surprise. I would highly recommend this hotel and…

This is a lovely newly built property in the middle of nowhere. I knew the limitations of its location in advance, just keep in mind it really is not convenient to any place. Took us over an hour from Tangier with bad traffic. Transportation is quite inflated in price for both the airport and city. On the map it is surrounded by green but we could not find any hiking trails or forest to explore, though we did enjoy walking around the extensive grounds that will eventually be a golf course (which you may love if you are a golfer but I had mixed feelings about seeing the natural habitat developed artificially.) The beach in front of and nearby the hotel is raw and undeveloped, and strewn with trash in places. Nonetheless impressive to look at and take walks but really…

We were there for a convention. The room was excellent, clean, and conforable bed. Staff members were very professionnal. Food was good. I recommend this hotel for any corporate event, and also for leisure.

column3: Amazing moment in Hilton Tanger El Houara
column4: Excellent stay Excellent service Amazing hotel with a direct access to the beach Spa & Kids area are cool I recommend for all the couple or families who want to take rest and enjoy beach & pool time under the sun

This is my 6th time at this hotel resort, and it s just an amazing experience everytime, the location, food and especially the spa manager and all the staff. And it s a really good value for all what you get.

column3: Everything was perfect, only to much noise of the airconditioning.
column4: The staff verry good !!!, including the restaurant! It was good in everthing. Only the airconditioning was verry interrupting.but i will come back in the future.many rhanks to the staff and cleaning deparhment.

I was very happy to spend a wekend in this huge and clean hotel. The staf was very professionnal and the hospitality was very nice. The hotel est very calm because it is so far from the tanger i liked it this.

column3: Wonderful Experience at Hilton Al Houara Resort
column4: This Resort exceed our expectation. The Service was amazing and the Staff members went beyond to please guests at this property. Kids enjoyed activities at kids Club... We will definitely come back and recommend it..

column3: Great hotel, missing attention to detail
column4: First of all the actual hotel is beautiful and the staff polite and friendly. The best sunsets I have seen in my life. The swimming pools are wonderful as are the free mint teas in the lobby area. Very clean, spotless hotel, great rooms and a very comfortable bed. Bathroom superb. Breakfast was great, plenty of variety. Great staff. Dinner was poor, catering quality and variety was limited over the week we stayed. With no alternatives to choose from outside the hotel this needs to be tweaked. Lucky for Hilton the staff of this hotel are wonderfull. The lunch menu in the Tucan beach bar was not up to Hiltons high standards considering the price, again with no alternative restaurants outside or near the hotel Hilton should put a bit more effort. The public beach is…

A friend and I stayed here for our first trip to Morocco - I had high expectations as a Hilton Diamond Lifetime member...and this lovely hotel and those who took care of us did not disappoint! Upon check in Miriam from reception settled us on comfy couches, brought us a delicious iced tea and checked us in. We had booked the 2 bedroom apartment with ocean views and Miriam showed us several available to get just the perfect view. There were a few bumps as this hotel opened less than 6 mo ago (one shower didn’t drain properly but one call to Miriam and all was fixed and well). Jalil, the concierge was so helpful via email before our visit - answering questions and booking day trips (visit Chechaouen “the blue city” - spectacular) with guide (necessary if you want to see all those…

column3: FANTASTIC IN SOME RESPECTS NOT IN OTHERS
column4: This Hilton is 6 months old so past the point of needing to fix new hotel problems. POSITIVE 1. The staff are amazing, always helpful, polite and engaging. Nothing is too much for them to do for you 2. The breakfast Buffett is amazing. So much fresh choice. You can't beat it. 3. The rooms, generally to a great standard ( some improvement needed see below) 4. The setting and location of the hotel is great. 5. The great guest services team who arranged a cake and card for my wife's birthday. Thank you NEGATIVE 1. Value for money on in house purchase- staying in a Hilton you expect to pay a premium for things such as drinks but an 800% mark up on retail soft drinks is pushing the boundaries of acceptance. The same goes for some of the food prices. Perhaps offer your guest a…

This brand spanking new resort is perfect for families or couples. There is so much room and so much to do that you never have to leave the resort. The staff, from chefs to cleaners, are fantastic, never too busy to say hello or help you with anything to make you more comfortable. Take a horseride on the beach around sunset and take a dip in the palm tree lined pool that could be in a 90s hip hop video.

#The personal, the best that they have! I would like thank all the staffs for the amazing job that they are doing, specially for Assya (Guest Relations) that since my reservation provides me all the information requested to make my arrival more confortable and surprise me with a beautiful decoration in the room for my honeymoon, the housekeeper Mrs.Shaymae was absolutely profesional and always has a smile to attend my requests. But person like Mr. El Monataz El Haddad does a difference, he and his staffs (Oumauma and Abdekkatif) made our breakfast time absolutely enjoyable, every day giving us some gastronomic sugestion and of course remembering our preferences comments days prior, his supervisor WOW me,It is the pure concept of Hospitaly! I cannot forgot to say thanks also…

A great new property stretched on the Atlantic coast, designed in Berber style. All this, along with the perfect and available staff, provides for a fairytale like stay. Unfortunately the wide sand strip to the ocean isn't organized, so we took advantage of the beach front pools, that were perfect. A few dining options here, out of which I will outline L'Olivier - a French gourmet, which was fantastic and the Pool bar Tucano for tapas. The breakfast was perfect, Hilton style. Cordially recommended and thanks for the experience!

This is new resort, opened in the spring 2019. Their rates were quite attractive – if they maintain them, its great value. The resort is suitable for relaxing stay, close to nice nature. Pool area very nicely designed. Beach not developed but I like it that way, as it has very natural feel. Food was great. Staff very nice and helpful. Being new the hotel had some teething issues. Spa was not yet open as – according to staff – there was some issues with slippery floor. Elevators had some electronic problems and not always worked properly. Overall we had great relaxing stay there.

Nothing to say about this Hotel but Fabulous !! I liked so much the staff everywhere, they are helping, smiling and doing whatever it is possible to make your stay at heaven on earth. The room was very large ; The kids club was very nice. The lobby very charming and the reception's staff were doing eveyrthing to make it simple for you either for check in or check out. I may report only one thing that I was not satisfied about it, which is the beach where there was no parasols and no service. The manager explained to me that is because the hotel has opened on April 2019, and they have not yet got the right to use the beach as a hotel. But you can of course go there since it is public. Anyway, that was my only remark and they promised me that by the next summer…

Great experience Stuff were friendly and smiling appt was great value for money comapred to 2 rooms at the same period, nice pool( not exposed to wind even on windy weather). Great breakfast varieties and most importantly great stuff

This is the kind of resorts we desperately need in morocco where you can really relax and unwind, I hope the hotel keeps up the good work until its fully operational. Pros: -the location away from everything, the beach and swimming pools, huge resort where you feel space even when its on high occupancy. -Most of the staff are genuinely nice and competent in their job, some lack training, but I liked the young spirit and motivation. Housekeeping team particularly under omar chaouni all doing a great job attending all our requests. -the breakfast is a key highlight, good choice of well prepared food and healthy juices, very complete, good work from the chefs and the servers jumping on every opportunity to help. Some improvements areas: -All food offering is on the very high end…

Booked a family vacation to this property, was a fantastic experience filled with great ambiance, scenery, wonderful rooms and friendly staff. The breakfast is great and the pool accommodating all members. Definitely recommend for a family escape.

This property is exceptional beautiful , great display of Moroccan architecture ever way you turn there beach, pool , green area or vaulted ceiling. Meriam front desk is wonderful we recognize her from Garden inn , she made sure we were well taken care off. The food both lunch and dinner was top notch , every dish was cooked to perfection . Mutasim , the tall waiter , the chief were great people making sure we try tens of dishes and amazing pastries. The hotel is very family friendly get away the kids club , the pool was fantastic. Night walking around the property on cool Atlantic ocean breeze after having all the great food was wonderful. Moroccan have great culture of welcoming people and property of such will make Tangier a destination.

column3: Great time together as a family
column4: The hotel staff and the housekeeping staff were great specially the supervisor Mr, Omar and the housekeeping Miss Majda they made our stay even more relaxed and the kids were very happy with them and my wife had a great time. Thanks for your good hospitality and your great services.

The stay throughout the 4 days was amazing, specifically due to the amazing and well-trained staff! Specially Soukaina abu Nakhla, Soukaina Qasimi, and Hanane el Gasbi. They made our stay extra special as their attitude was extremely professional and helpful. In addition, the house keeping employees did their job really well and we’re very smiley too! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

The hotel is gorgeous with the view on the ocean and big gardens The service is poor and not for that kind of hotels. i booked there for 3 nights but i left after only one! The reason is because i called them to prepare something as we just married and wanna stay there before our flight for honeymoon but when we came that early morning when the wedding is off we find nothing and the room was simple even i told them. The worst thing is that they made us wait at the lobby for more than 30 minutes Disgusting service and ashamed reception

We had the best time at this hotel the staff was really friendlly we are road tripping through marocco and this was our first hotel the room was very good with clening is perfect finally i want to give a grand thanks for chafika from housekeeping for everything

A unique experience at this superb hotel. We liked all infrastructure , quality of service, refined food. The sunsets are magic, we did not miss a single one. Most of the employees are young, nice looking, very passionate about their job. We will definitely come back.

First time in this new hotel. I have to say someting about the service. You are treated like a king. 🤴🏻 There are 3 restaurants here, a high class dining place, a buffet restaurant and a nice place by the pool. I had service by Hamza T. and Naoufal E. and i have to say these are 2 of the most friendly guys I know here. You want something? These guys will bring it with a smile. Nice views and a great pool. See it to for yourself. The breakfast is big, just ask the friendy staff and they will bring it in a hearbeat. I will come again when I visit Tanger.

Upon arrival to the hotel. As Gold members we were greeted and escorted to the lobby area by a nice smiley lady. While our icy towels and fresh drinks were being prepared. She took our passports to check-in. We enjoyed a sundowner dinner at ‘Le Olivieri’ restaurant. Superb meal it was. muhammed El-Amrani the F&B attendant was high-end welcoming and kind in everything. Hana’a the Restauarant supervisor was excellent host. Quiet enthusiastic and dedicated. Her history and tory telling of Moroccan history was an incredible . A warm touch it was. We enjoyed every moment with you. Mariam Bahbah Front office supervisor. Her attitude, kindness and professional approach made us feel at home. She took care of everything from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. She…

Very beautiful resort... even if it’s not yet finished... I believe once finished this resort might be the best in Morocco The staff is very friendly comparing to other hotels in Morocco. A special thanks to Hamza who is always available and very friendly... I always followed his recommendations in term of food and it was always amazing. Thanks to his colleague Nohaila as well. The breakfast is good as well even if it still limited in term of choices. Special thanks to Salma who took care of us during breakfast time and thanks to Soukaina who is always smiling. I’ll come back next year and hope it will be finished before that

column3: Such a hard review to write
column4: Being frequent Hilton customers I found myself disappointed with our stay at this newly open hotel with such great potential. My partner and I both agree that the hotel was beautiful, the pool and access to the beach were great however the hotel website made the resort appear fully open which isn’t the case. The hotel was sold to have a golf course, spa with barbers and resources such as an onsite shop. None of these were open, or available to guests - this is something we only found out once we had arrived at the hotel. Argon is a buffet breakfast and either buffet (£37/40 per person) or Al la Carte in the evening. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the staff couldn’t do enough for us - El Mouataz was by far the best member of staff within the food and beverage team,…

A pretty new hotel in this beautiful region in Morocco. A very warm welcome at the arrival. The appartement is spacious and well equipped. The breakfast is yummy and the service is perfect. A big thanks to Assya the guest relation manager for her precious help. A special huge thanks to Hamza Talbi the waiter at Tucano restaurant, amazing person , very helpful,kind and happy man. I highly recommend this beautiful hotel a specially for families.

Beside the fact, that the hotel's golf green isn't operational yet, this hotel is truly a magical place to be. Every single staff member was helpful, kind and a undoubtly a high skilled professional who will make your stay even more special. Even though the golf wasn't ready, we immediately got a free ride to a 30min distance golf club. Every hotel member will take care of your wishes, you are in good hands. Special thanks to Sara Slimani, who answered all my questions and took care of me with a smile <3 unlike the elevator, we were very happy ;) The best food experiences we had in restaurant argon. Find El Mouataz am haddalahi - he will double your enjoyment! Beside that. Super view, pool and food. Can truly recommended this hotel and will come again if I visit Tanger again.…

column3: hilton spa resort with no spa
column4: new spa resort no spa rooms and restaurants many ants they only clean tables after you arrive not clean pools no hot water need more staff and more training bad experience staying with hilton hotels since 2007

column3: nice hotel in a very location
column4: I stayed at this hotel for two nights ... The staff at the reception restaurant and the breakfast were good and friendly. The breakfast has lots of varieties and the restaurant has tables overlooking the sea which I loved. The room is very nice and its cleanliness so cool that I want to thank Shafiqa from Housekeeping for her wonderful service

The resorts isn’t completely finished and open , but I had an amazing experience. I have spent the day at the pool and beach , staff is amazing , thanks to Hamza for his service and attention ! We will be back soon !

This hotel is located in a very nice place, easy to access the highway and you can go to Tanga or Asilah cities. good for families, couples and also business meetings. we are certenlly will back to this hotel again and again

column3: best kept secret super luxury, but will not be for long !
column4: The Hilton Tangier Al Houara Resort & Spa hotel is the best kept secret super luxury hotel, as this newly opened hotel is just 2 months old. This is an amazing hotel , 6 star quality . Book a stay before the secret gets out. I stayed with my family of 3 teenage boys and wife. The resort is new but the staff are very experienced , Jalil the Chief Concierge is a veteran to luxury hotels and delivers a world class service. El Mouataz the Food and Beverage supervisor ensured our evening buffet was an eating experience fit for royalty. I always rate my Hiltons' over 5 headings:- Location, Exec Lounge, hotel Interior , Gym and Staff Location:- 35 mins outside Tangers , but it has kids club , 3 pools , amazing food ( breakfast / dinner amazing ) , beach , great walks , chilled…

column3: Great Hospitality in an amazing luxury property
column4: The service we got was amazing and the property is magnificent with all the facilities in it. The Olivier Resturant offered great food and amazing sunset view. Location maybe a little bit out of the city about 25 mins but the quality offered is unrivaled and worth the ride.

a big thanks to mohammed superviseur and hassan they showing me the nices place in the hotel . and the room services its reallly amazing and dont forget to thanks houda I love to find a skate park in the hotel it will be the first hotel in morocco have a skate park

column3: Still working a few kinks out...
column4: Quick summary- This is a beautiful property with excellent customer service. And when they get the transportation situation ironed out they’ll definitely be five stars all the way. The service - especially the front line employees: waiters, housekeeping, bell staff, were so friendly and helpful. Really, really impressive. And they seemed to speak all the major and regional languages so it seemed like they had someone for everyone. The restaurants were all great - I had two wonderful dinners at L’Olivier and as a solo traveler was incredibly impressed with the wines by the glass :). Aragan had a wonderful breakfast with buffet with a great mix of local delicacies and international fare. As I mention in the summary my only knock is on the “management” of the location. I knew…

We spent a week with my family for vacation a this resort and it was a great experience. Nice hotel, we had nice weather and people there are very friendly and helpful. We would love to go back for another visit in the future

column3: Has potential, but not a resort yet.
column4: Diamond member review. The hotel is absolutely beautiful with amazing views over the Atlantic Ocean, and the staff were all very kind and helpful. Where the hotel falls short is location and any form of adult entertainment. I was aware that the hotel was a distance from town but there where no available taxi outside or near the hotel. Also there is nothing around (walking distance) the resort for a 5 mile radius. The hotel charged 400 MAD (£33) oneway into town and would not help with an outside taxi even though the welcome booklet in the room advises that they do. I was also not informed that there is an available shuttle bus that takes you into town everyday at 10am, that information would have been helpful when checking in. Once the sunsets and the swimming pool closes…

Even though I didn't choose the Hilton Tangier Al Houara, I was pleasantly surprised to live this unique experience in a very pleasant setting, a heavenly nature, a quality service and a helpful staff

This resort was the most relaxed resort I've stayed at in a few years. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Very good pricing for the time of the year as well. Coming back for sure for more me time

column3: A very relaxing stay. Beautiful hotel with great staff.
column4: I stayed at the hotel for a week for some relaxation and came away feeling very refreshed. The hotel grounds are beautiful and look out onto an almost-deserted sandy beach. There are two main pools - one at a natural temperature and one heated, which gives a great choice depending on the weather and the time of day. There is also a pool for kids. There are plenty of sun loungers and parasols and a poolside drinks service which is helpful but not pushy. I believe the spa and golf courses are due to open soon, but not having them didn't affect my stay. My deluxe sea-view room was spacious, comfortable, spotlessly clean and extremely peaceful. All rooms seem to have balconies. There is free internet access. The hotel staff are all extremely friendly. I genuinely felt they wanted…

This place is a combination of modern and traditional Morocco. The architecture and design are a perfect match to the Antlantic seafront of Tangier. Perfect for relaxing and making the most of the hotel's services. Staff takes good care of everything during your stay… Thanks, will be back soon!!

Words do not do justice to the service, welcome, nor love experienced here. Hamza and Adnan always ensure that you are cared for with beautifully created original cocktails delivered with a smile that would light up an entire city. In addition, the restaurant sommelier Amin has some of the best wine on list that I have ever tasted. Houssam is the manager who meets every need you might have. Nouhaila Hossaibi, Jihane, and Issam are THE best wait staff I’ve ever encountered.....and I lived in Chicago for eight years. People of the world, do yourselves a favor and come be attended to, pampered, and loved in Tangier. This place deserves ten stars.

Wonderful hotel. The staff is very polite and helpful. The nearby beach is just amazing. The hotel just opened so not all services were available (SPA and activities have not started yet.) Overall, I would definitely do it again. Just one remark, the food menu should include more local products. Food prices are a bit on the high side.

column3: A hotel with potential but a couple of issues to be addressed
column4: We chose this hotel as we were in Tangier for only 2 nights and had a early flight home - this hotel is indeed close to the airport and also close to the beach. However, the beach hasn't been cleaned yet ; the surroundings of the hotel in general aren't fully cleaned / landscaped yet, still under construction. We had a couple issues that altered the quality of our stay: - Bathroom: the shower door wasn't properly sealed so the leak flooded the bathroom. The hot and cold taps were reversed. The bathroom wasn't fully clean when we arrived. - Dining experience: we were given contradictory information about dining options. We were there on a Sunday and the all-day dining restaurant was closed. The only option we had for food was a snacking bar or room service, which was a bad look…

The location and the view are amazing but the problem was with the room service and also they don’t call back when there’s no one to answer , everything else was amazing i recommend the hotel to spend your vacation

column3: Beautiful new property, but no liquor license and far away from the city area
column4: The hotel is a very luxe and a top of the line resort with an amazing seaside view. It is about 40 minutes from Tangier city location Hilton (which is a better alternative.) If you are looking to "escape" and golf, then this is the one for you. Check if the liquor license has been issued yet and whether restaurants and bars are open before booking, as this might be a disappointing surprise, as it was for us.

The hotel is magic, specially in the sunset, you can feel the nature and enjoy a good time away from the normal life. The room, the bathroom, the terrace, were perfect, specially the bathrobe, a completely relaxing sensation. We felt welcome from the first moment we have arrived, the concierge and the reception team walked us by the hotel and explain the hotel structure and all the facilities/services. Every team of the staff was warm and friendly, at the reception, housekeeping, swimming pool, at the dinner and, in particular at the breakfast: all the breakfast team were smiling and taking particular attention to the details (they catch your preferences and anticipate your needs). Also, we love hummus, and they had made us find 3 kind of hummus the following day!! We have…

Absolutely incredible place. Immaculate and the staff are impeccable - so helpful and friendly. The food was incredible too! I will definitely be going back there. The whole trip was very relaxing and enjoyable!

Really a great location, clean rooms, and the thing that makes this such a good place to stay are the staff.speacialy Mr yassine in the pool area incredibly helpful and generous with his time and advice.

column3: The one and da only in Morocco 💪
column4: Let me say that it is the best 5 star hotel I have ever seen, it's exemplary in hospitality and gracious handling, food very delicious, Harmonic and servile Staff (specialy Reda, Hamza nd da pretty Bouchra El), Bedrooms are comfortable to the fullest, clean and Superior, the interior and exterior Design are world-class, I like everything in there & i Recommend 😊👍
